actionItem.description: Record the next step in the negotiation process.
actionItem.name: actionItem

altSalesRangeHigh.description: Must be greater than or equal to the amount in the projaltsalesamt field.
altSalesRangeHigh.name: altSalesRangeHigh

altSalesRangeLow.description: Must be lower than or equal to the projected amount in the projaltsalesamt field.
altSalesRangeLow.name: altSalesRangeLow

billAddressList.externalId.description: Defaults to the address associated with the selection for billAddress. If explicitly set via web services, this acts as a custom address and overrides for this transaction only.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

buyingReason.externalId.description: Choose the prospect or customer's reason for buying from your company. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.
buyingReason.externalId.name: buyingReason.externalId

buyingReason.internalId.description: Choose the prospect or customer's reason for buying from your company. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.
buyingReason.internalId.name: buyingReason.internalId

buyingReason.name.name: buyingReason.name

buyingTimeFrame.externalId.description: Select the time frame for the prospect or customer to purchase. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

closeDate.description: This field corresponds to the date that the Opportunity entityStatus is set to Closed Won. Note that this field is read-only in both the UI and in Web services.
closeDate.name: closeDate

currency.externalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.name.name: currency.name

currencyName.description: References a value from a user defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies.
currencyName.name: currencyName

customForm.externalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

daysOpen.description: This field shows the number of days this opportunity has been open.
daysOpen.name: daysOpen

In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Defaults to the value set at Setup > Sales > Preferences > Sales Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

entityTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
entityTaxRegNum.internalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.internalId

estGrossProfit.description: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfit.name: estGrossProfit

estGrossProfitPercent.description: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfitPercent.name: estGrossProfitPercent

estimatedBudget.description: Enter the estimated budget the prospect or customer has for this opportunity.
estimatedBudget.name: estimatedBudget

exchangeRate.description: Defaults to the current exchange rate for the currency associated with the company referenced in the entity field. This can only be provided for an add.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

expectedCloseDate.description: Required when default preferences are turned off. Defaults to the current Date/Time.
expectedCloseDate.name: expectedCloseDate

forecastType.externalId.description: References an existing Forecast Type defined at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences > Forecasts (subtab on Preferences page). Note that although the display name for each forecast type can be customized, the actual internal ID associated with each forecast type is static as follows: Low Forecast Name: 1 Medium Forecast Name: 2 High Forecast Name: 3

For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

memo.description: Enter additional information about the opportunity.
memo.name: memo

nexus.externalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.externalId.name: nexus.externalId

nexus.internalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

partner.externalId.description: References a partner record that already exists in your account. If a value is not provided, the field is populated with the partner associated with the company referenced in the entity field (if a partner exists for that company).In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

probability.description: If the value for probability is not provided, a calculated value based on the Status populates the field.If the value for probability is set, it overrides the slaved value depending on the default settings. For example: If conditional defaults are ON, on update the probability changes if the status changes and the probability is NOT specified in the request. If conditional defaults are OFF, on update the probability does NOT change if status changes. If conditional defaults are ON, and a value for both status and probability are submitted, then the submitted values are set.
probability.name: probability

projAltSalesAmt.description: Sets the projected alternate sales amount of the opportunity based on the items selected on the opportunity and the estimates associated with the opportunity.
projAltSalesAmt.name: projAltSalesAmt

projectedTotal.description: This field is required when there are no items in the itemList field. When items are listed and a value is not provided, the field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.
projectedTotal.name: projectedTotal

rangeHigh.description: If not provided, this field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.
rangeHigh.name: rangeHigh

rangeLow.description: If not provided, this field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.
rangeLow.name: rangeLow

salesGroup.externalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.externalId.name: salesGroup.externalId

salesRep.externalId.description: References an employee record that already exists in your account. If a value is not provided, the field is populated with the sales representative associated with the company referenced in the entity field (if a sales representative exists for that company). The referenced employee record must have a status set as sales rep or an error is thrown.This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the OpportunityItemList list.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesRep.externalId.name: salesRep.externalId

salesRep.internalId.description: References an employee record that already exists in your account. If a value is not provided, the field is populated with the sales representative associated with the company referenced in the entity field (if a sales representative exists for that company). The referenced employee record must have a status set as sales rep or an error is thrown.This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the OpportunityItemList list.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesRep.internalId.name: salesRep.internalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId

syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the partner team on the customer record with the changes you make here.
syncPartnerTeams.name: syncPartnerTeams

syncSalesTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer record with the changes you make here.
syncSalesTeams.name: syncSalesTeams

taxDetailsOverride.description: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.
taxDetailsOverride.name: taxDetailsOverride

taxRegOverride.description: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.
taxRegOverride.name: taxRegOverride

title.description: Sets the value of the title displayed on lists, reports and on the Opportunities subtab of the record the opportunity is associated with.
title.name: title

totalCostEstimate.description: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.
totalCostEstimate.name: totalCostEstimate

tranDate.description: Required when default preferences are turned off. Defaults to the current Date/Time.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: Sets a unique ID number for the transaction. If a value is not provided, the system assigns a number. If the value is not unique an error is thrown. By default, any autonumbering of opportunity records is allowed to be overridden. However, if you are explicitly setting a value for tranID and that value is NOT being set in the system, you may have the Allow Override disabled. To enable overriding of autonumbering, go to Set Up > Company > Set up Auto-Generated Numbers > Transactions tab. Then check Allow Override in the Opportunity row and click Save.
tranId.name: tranId

type.value.description: References a company record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
type.value.name: type.value

weightedTotal.description: Defaults to a calculated value that is dependent on total amounts associated with items in itemList.
weightedTotal.name: weightedTotal

winLossReason.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Sales > CRM Lists > Win/Loss Reason. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see WinLossReason. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
winLossReason.name.name: winLossReason.name
